awd_abstract_narration: The proposed research utilizes a variety of accelerators in the                 U.S., Canada and Europe to study intermediate and high energy                   nuclear reactions.  These studies examine both the dynamics of                  the nuclear reactions and the degrees of freedom required to                    describe the structure of the nuclear states.  The major emphasis               of the program will involve studies of electromagnetic processes.               In particular with the expected completion of CEBAF accelerator                 in 1994, much of the effort will be directed toward the                         experiments associated with the CEBAF.  An additional project                   involves the construction of a recoil neutron polarimeter (HARP)                which will be used at NIKHEF and CEBAF.  The proposed                           experiments, at CEBAF as well as NIKHEF and MIT-Bates, address                  physics questions ranging from the determination of nuclear                     structure functions to nucleon-nucleon correlations in nuclei to                the underlying quark structure of baryon resonances.  An                        experiment at even higher energy to measure J/Psi production in                 nuclei is being contemplated. Hadron-induced studies at other                   facilities will tend to emphasize the measurement of polarization               observable, either with polarized incident particles, polarized                 nuclear targets, or both.  Such measurements provide additional                 constraints and information on the medium corrections to the                    interactions and the role of relativity in the processes.                                                                                                        //
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
